channel.title: config.cfg file settings not holding (auto aim)
channel.description:
Hi all Not sure if this is intentional or a bug, so here goes.
When in game I am trying to get the autoaim option switched off via options-> black mesa tab, but it's not holding the setting between mod restarts.
When I un-tick auto aim & click on apply, the console shows the file has been written to as it shows as Host_WriteConfiguration: Wrote cfg/config.cfg
Now when I quit out of the mod & re-load it & check the setting its back to its default of ON...
[u]have tried[/u] Manually editing the config.cfg file in sourcemods\bms\cfg & setting the sk_autoaim_mode "1" to sk_autoaim_mode "0" now set the file to read only, (I'm guessing the above option is for auto aim)
On game launch the option is back to ON, needless to say if I try to change it in game in won't work due to file been set a read only.
[u]Have tried[/u] deleting the config.cfg file from sourcemods\bms\cfg When mod is launched the config.cfg file gets re-created & can be amended in game. However the option still does not hold.
I have tried changing some of the other option with the black mesa tab such as Iron sight / Iron sight sticky / always run & these settings as selected [u]do[/u] hold
Am currently using a re-generated config.cfg file with black mesa tab options left on there defaults
Any thoughts?
